Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I went back last week for my three month appointment after having chemo, masectomy and rads and I have just been infiormed I have to have a PET scan after telling the oncologist about rib pain. Has any out there had this scan I am so worried now and dread it. Would so much like to hear from anyone who has experinced it. Hugs to all, Maggie
Posts.Title: PET scan

Posts.Content: "The things people say ?............NO, don't bother........... PLEASE!!!!!" ? That's how I feel about the things people say, bless them,  they mean well. Take care everyone, maggie
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: So sorry, my post came out all wrong ........... What I meant to say was, title for book....  "You don't say? Please don't " Maggie xxx
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Hi Karen. I had my surgery January23 this year and was ok until after the radiotherapy, 15 sessions ending April,    Since then I have experienced pain in the operation area which now seems to be getting worse.  I am taking seven cocodomol tablets a day and have a morphine patch and am still very uncomfortable and cant keep a bra on all day.  I suffered from depression too which I got myself through without anti depressants although I take half a lorazapan at night and sometimes a quarter at lunch time if it is bad, I hate taking tablets.  I really thought I would be feeling more normal by now and realise I must get in touch with the breast nurse, I keep hoping it will get better.  I had an appointment with the physio but it really hurt me and I cancelled. Everyone seems to think I am over it so I try to keep a lot of it to myself.  Hugs Maggie
Posts.Title: a year neally after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Karen. Did you ask for an appointment to see your consultant or did your doctor refer you? I have no confidence in my doctor at all - I asked him if I could go to the pain clinic and he said "What can they do?".  I am just taking the coodomol and using the morphine patches but I am irritable all the time with it.and I sleep ok I think because of the lorazapan,  You are very strong person to be able to work a twelve hour shift, I couldn't do that, no way, Please let me know how you get on, I suppose I will have to get in touch with the hospital but It is getting very near Christmas now, all the best , Maggie
Posts.Title: a year neally after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi spicedtea, I am three years on, right mastectomy, chemo and rads and have mild lymphoedema. I haven't found a comfortable bra yet ....... however, I found bra vests from Witt International. The one I wear is £14.99, it has lacey shoulder straps and under the bust too, so soft nd pretty and stretchy. It  also holds my softie perfectly.. I wouldn't waste any more money on bras now I have found these. Hope this is useful information. Hugs, Maggie
Posts.Title: Bras again!

Posts.Content: Thank you Kate and Alison for your replies.  I called the breast nurse and she says it is nothing to worry about and that you can have swelling like this and I have probably been doing too much lifting, I will try and find those exercises to  pump the arm to improve circulation, I worry too much but that is how it is with me, thank you very much, Maggie
Posts.Title: swelling of arm

Posts.Content: Thankyou G n J I have found the exercises and will do them religiously,  Thank you for your time and trouble, take care Maggie
Posts.Title: swelling of arm

Posts.Content: I finished my treatment in April 2013, chemo mx and radiotherapy, it seems that now I am more active and doing quite a bit in the garden that my arm is slightly swollen and feels uncomfortable. can anyone tell me if this is because I am overdoing it or is it to be expected even after a year has passed? I haven't been doing my excercises for quite a few months and wonder if this is what is causing it, I know this is just a small worry but just wonder if anyone else has experienced it? Thank you all, this is such a good place to express your worries, thank you, Maggie
Posts.Title: swelling of arm

Posts.Content: I had terrible constipation , it IS awful, MOVICOL is the answer, so quick and easy to take.  That will be a relief I know, I had to ask my doctor for it after a lady on here recommended it, all the best, take care, Maggie with hugs
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi coastal lady, I have had rib pain since my mastectomy in 2013. It seems to be getting worse. I also have lymphodema  in  My right arm. I am on 4 cocodamol  a day and three amitriptyline at night. I just feel I am putting all these chemicals into my body unnecessarily. Please tell me the magnesium and supplements did the trick for you. I sincerely hope they did. Take care, maggie hugs
Posts.Title: Rib Pain - Arimidex

Posts.Content: Hi coastal lady, I think I replied  under the wrong tag! I have had horrible rib pain ever since my mastectomy  in 2013. Chemo, op and 15 radiotherapy. I am wondering if the magnesium and supplements proved helpful. I am taking 4cocodamol  daily and three amitriptyline at night. I feel as I am putting all these chemicals into my body unnecessarily.  I would so love to hear that the magnesium, calcium, etc.helped you. Take care, maggie
Posts.Title: Rib Pain - Arimidex

Posts.Content: Can someone please help me?  I have had chemo, masectomy and 15 radio therapy treatments. I am suffering bllisters but these are gradually drying up and falling off The problem is I have these terrible pains in my ribs.  I have mentioned it many times during my treatment and the local GP.   I dont seem tobe able to get any help.  The surgeon, after the operation, said, its a bit tight but we wont worry about it.  Is this one of the thijgs that is going to get worse before it gets better?   I am ten daysafter finishing treatment. I cant walk around or sit up with the pain - which have got worse since rads. Any advice or anyone with experience of this I would be glad SO glad to hear from. Maggie
Posts.Title: rib pains

Posts.Content: Thank you Dorothee for you answer to my plea!!!!!!  I am again in pain today and waiting for the specialist nurse to call me back.  It doesnt help that I am all blisters on one side of my chest and they are drawing and sometimes with the under  arm side feeling tender (if you know what I mean) I feel like I need the cusion again!!!  I feel like a disaster area and after all the chemo and op and rads I really thought I would be getting a bit of relief -I think that is rather overwhelming me. Also they did nkick my osophogus with the rads and I couldnt swallow for quite a few days and had to go on to morpine - I am not a moaning minnie I try to be brave but it seems the light at the end of the tunnel isnt getting any brighter.    My husband has been wonderful through the whole thing, he can now use the dish washer and the washing machine!!!!!!!   I think they are all so disappointed that after all this, I am still suffering new pains and expected me to be getting better by now,  I am afraid their patience will run out and I wiuldnt blame them. Thanks again,k and good luck and good health to alll of you out there, lets beat the devil!! love Maggie
Posts.Title: rib pains

Posts.Content: P>S> Dorothee   Love your wine and chocs, but I cant have wine yet beause I am on lorazapan for nigfhts just a half but I do love my choccies xxmaggie  I also LOVE red wine .... roll on...................................................
Posts.Title: rib pains

Posts.Content: Hi Tipper and Spudly, I read what you both had to say and I am in complete agreement with all you say.  Whatever, friends and family cannot understand what this does to your mind however much they love you and I suppose because they love you they just want YOU back.  I am looking at it like a grieving - you cannot get over it in a few months, we stand all the shocks and treatment and are strong because there is nothing else we can do and a lot of it is kept bottled up. THEN BOOM!!  we are on our on with our thoughts and it is like delayed action, you cant quite let go.  When I told the oncologist I still had pain in my arm etc., he said  "it is early days!" I finished my radiotherapy April 11th and still had the three month check up to go,, but after that (I have been told nine months for next one - which I am querying today)  I think we can only take one day at a time and see how gradually we can come back to something, not as we weere, but good in a different way.  Wheres theres life - theres hope.  Thank you, all you wonderful women out there, you are the only ones who can fully understand, big hugs,, Maggie
Posts.Title: All Done ... So what am I ??

Posts.Content: Thank you SaxxyD, You have said exactly what I was thinking,you see you are a bit further on and you give out hope.  It is hard at times but we ARE lucky - we have had good treatment in a country which we should be proud of and  however much they moan about the health service where could you beat it.  Hugs xxx
Posts.Title: All Done ... So what am I ??

Posts.Content: Yes, that does bother me a bit at the moment.  I had chemo, rb mx and rads. Three month exam on 4th July and now not back till next May unless anything is worrying me.   I still have pains in arm and side etc.,  and scar too but I am wondering what would justify asking for an appointment.  I know its early days but do feel a bit cast off sort of thing
Posts.Title: All Done ... So what am I ??

Posts.Content: Hi Julia, Reading through the posts, I noticed that you said you had a rib problem. It's three years now since I had chemo,r mastectomy then radiotherapy. I have pains in my ribs and lunch time is usually the longest I can keep my bra done up.my doctor says it is costrochonditis and I take solpadol and paracetamol which do t ha e any real affect. This is the first time I ha e heard anyone mention ribs.  Can I ask if you ha e been diagnosed with Costco and what treatment you are having?  It really gets me down. All the best, Maggie
Posts.Title: Long term impact of chemo?

Posts.Content: Thanks, Julia, maybe someone will spot this. I am constantly uncomfortable. Maybe I should be a bit more forceful at the doctors surgery.  Maggie
Posts.Title: Long term impact of chemo?

Posts.Content: Has anyone had any experience of lymphoedema?  My upper arm was slightly swollen for a few weeks and then I was bitten and it really swelled up.  I went to the breast clinic and was given a course of antibiotics which I am half way through, sometimes it seems more swollen that others.  I also have an appointment to go the lymphodeama  clinic in about three weeks.  Does anyone know if there are different levels of this cojmplaint.  I should have asked these questions this morning, but the nurse was so pleased with the arm she said "all ok" and everything went from my mind.  Would be good to talk to someone who has actually experienced it.  We aren't told about this, or at least I wasn't warned about this at the end of treatment.  Any experience ladies, please, Maggie (ps finished my chemo, mastectomy and rads in April last year and had no swelling until now)
Posts.Title: lymphoedema

Posts.Content: Thanks so much Bongo and little Susie for your posts.  Did you have any swelling at all Bongo?  My younger  son lives in Portugal by the way.  He is into permaculture and stuff and has a farm there. I do do those excercises, I just wish I hadn't been so stupid and asked her some questions but I suppose I will have to wait the three weeks for the appointment at the lymphoedeama clinic and hope that it doesn't swell any more.  Thank you so much for posting. All the very best, Maggie
Posts.Title: lymphoedema

Posts.Content: Thank you so much Alison, can you have lymphoedema without swelling then?  My arm movement is ok but I feel a bit tight around the scar area.  I do shrugs and arms circles and stuff.  I will be glad when I get to the lymphoedema clinic and can find out more as there is not much response to my post, well, not from anyone who has actually had it and I don't know if I have it or not - I suppose I must have if I have go to the clinic.  Thank you, take care, Maggie
Posts.Title: lymphoedema

Posts.Content: Hi Judi,. I was interested to read about your pain and tightness, etc.  It is two years now since I finished treatment, and I am still experiencing this. I won't write too much as you may have stopped visiting the site, as indeed I have, but this is actually the first time I have read of anyone being like this and would love to talk to someone in the same position.  I have had two yearly check ups so far and have been told about cutting through nerves etc.  Love to hear have made friend request.  All the best Maggie
Posts.Title: Pain still getting worse - is this normal?

Posts.Content: Hi Lyndy,I had chemo for twelve weeks ending just before Christmas and then on Jan 23rd had right breast masectomy and am waiting for start of three weeks radiotherapy. When I was feeling sorry for myself and down I would say to my body "OK, I feel bad but you must be in agony, you are being killed"It is a matter of one day at a time and every day you are nearer to your goal. My hair is getting thickerand I can go round the house without scarves etc...... its like having a baby with all the stress that bringsbut BOY wont it be worth it. It will soon be a memory!!!
Posts.Title: nervous about starting chemo

Posts.Content: I had 12 weeks chemo then right breast masectomy in January followed by fifteen radiotherapy sessions. It seems now that after a week from finishing rads,, I am more uncomfortable than through all the treatments. My chest is burning and I have loads of small mustard colour blisters, I phoned the nurse and she said "no more cream" and then I heard of alloe vera, I have bought some but am a bit scared to use it. Anyone had any experience ?Good luck everyone out there, Maggie
Posts.Title: blisters

Posts.Content: thank you Rebecca, how long did it take for the blisters to clear and stop itching? Maggie
Posts.Title: blisters

Posts.Content: When I went back for my first check up after chemo, mx and rads I was told they were very pleased with me and then I mentioned my rib pains.  The oncologist arranged for a scan Just before I was due to go I was phoned and told that as that machine was undergoing modifications - I was to have a PET.  I went back for the results ten days ago and the doctor could not find any results of the scan and we told her it was changed to PET.  She came back and said sorry all was good no cancer, bones, lungs, kidneys etc.  Meanwhile an appointment had been made for me to go to the osteoporosis dept for consultation.  She also couldnt find the scan and then we told her the story and she said she had got it and now I would now need a bone scan.  If on the PET all was well with bones - why do I now need another one?  I want to phone the breast nurse but feel I am being a bit over anxious or stupid.  Have I missed something?  And why did I have a PET if that was not going to show up the condition of my bones.  Also the oncologist told us that my bones were just showing the nomal ageing process. She was a stranger to us as it was so busy we did not have our usual consultant.  Its a case of all the things you mean to say and dont and i  didnt question the osteoporosis nurse.   My next follow up appointment is next May.(for c) I did phone and query that and they said that was how they worked in Addenbrookes once yearly after only one three month one.  I dont know who to speak to, do your bc nurses have all  your details in front of them when you phone - I dont want to be a nuiscance but it is worrying, there seems to be a lack of communication somewhere.  Any ideas or experiences - lovely ladies out there?  All the best and corners up!!  Maggie
Posts.Title: so confused

Posts.Content: Has anyone had any experience with a compression sleeve for lymphedema? I was measured and.fitted with one to be worn from getting up till evening meal time. The first time I tried it my arm was more swollen an hour or two after removing it. I phoned the nurse and she said it was not given to me by accident and that I had been measured and to leave it off over the weekend. I have done this and had it in for five hours today and again my arm is more swollen and uncomfortable. I am loath to phone her again and don't know what to do. Her attitude was "you can't expect it to go down straight away". I wasn't expecting that anyway and was under the impression that the sleeve was to keep the swelling under control. I would be so grateful t o hear from anyone who has any experience or knowledge about this. Thank you, Maggie
Posts.Title: compression sleeve

Posts.Content: Thank you SaxxyD and G n J for your posts, it is such a comfort just for someone to be listening to what I am experiencing with this.  I don't know about everyone else but after going for my first check up after treatment had finished last April, I seem to be just adrift and having to cope and manage without any expert advice. I have read the MacMillan pamphlet and have just brought it up again and am going to print it out. Thank you.  Also I have discovered there is a clinic in Snettisham which is quite a distance but worth it, of course, if I can just speak to someone who knows. I have worn the sleeve from 8.30 this morning and have gone about my usual household chores and a bit of pruning ( with gloves) and a going to take it off at meal time this evening as the nurse told me to and see if my arm is more swollen. I have realised that it is not too tight as my fingers are normal so I will see how it is later and if more swollen, I will see the Doctor tomorrow and she if she can refer me to Snettisham, I assume that is the thing to do.   Or, if not, as you say , see if I can find a local practitioner somewhere near. The nurse said the nearest one was fifty miles away and was £50 an hour.  My husband is all for this but I would like to see if I can have it on the NHS if possible.  I am English born here and have never had benefit of any kind in all our working lives.  Sorry, sore point. That is a good idea with the first aid kit, you never know, better safe than sorry.  Thank you SO much for your time and trouble.  All the very best to everyone, Maggie
Posts.Title: compression sleeve

Posts.Content: Sorry should read my common sense tells me that my arm should NOT swell more after I have been wearing it.  Maggie
Posts.Title: compression sleeve

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your post SaxxyD it is good to talk to someone who actually knows about this.  As I said my arm swells when I wear the sleeve, I asked the nurse when she fitted the sleeve about the simple massage technique and she says they are not trained for it. This is the University hospital Addenbrookes in Cambridge. When she told me to take it off for the weekend and put in on again on Monday, I couldn't understand what difference that would make, but I did it with the same outcome - my arm was more swollen at the top after an hour or so of removing it.  She said I would have to pay to be taught the simple drainage massage and when I read about it, they say to wear the compression sleeve while the massage is being carried out.  I suppose the best thing I can do is go to my doctor and see what she has to say.  It is not a huge swelling and I wonder does every case justify the sleeve? I would just love to talk to somebody who knows what they are talking about and get on with whatever I have to do.  I have been on the verge of phoning the nurse at the hospital again but I have no confidence in her I am afraid,  My fingers aren't swollen or my wrist just my upper arm, it looks like well developed muscle!!   My common sense tells me my arm should swell more when after I have been wearing it.  I have read so much stuff about it my head is spinning. Once again thank you for answering, I suppose its a case of every patient is different do you think? Maggie
Posts.Title: compression sleeve

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  I went to the doctor with the prescription for the spare compression sleeve but she could not help me with a referral to a practitioner for simple lymphatic massage.  I have been wearing the sleeve most days up until five ish and some days the swelling is less.  The normal arm is 9 inches and the affected arm is 10 and a half inches, I just give this information in case there is anyone who has a swelling like mine. I have sent for the dvd on self massage for lymphatic drainage from the Lymphatic Support Group in London and also a stress ball. I have looked at so many sites to find out how to do it, they are mostly the same, so I do what I can and do the excercises as well.  I do not go to the clinic for another four weeks and then I have some more questions that I am going to ask .  I am hoping that there will be more information on the dvd.  My arm does not ache, or hurt and my fingers so not swell, again this info is for anyone who is in the same position as me.  I would love to talk to someone who is. Thanks everyone who answered my original questions, all the very best, Maggie
Posts.Title: compression sleeve

Posts.Content: Does anyone have any tips or advice on anxiety.  I have finished all my treatment and had three month follow up.  I have to have a bone scan for bone thinning, which I am really dreading (the four hour wait) I had PET scan and no cancer in bones, lungs, kidneys etc and I should be pleased but I find I am in a constant state of anxiety and sometimes breathlessness,, the more I thinbk about it the worse it gets.  I go back in May for next follow up, that is how they work in Addenbrookes. Any adice please????   Maggie
Posts.Title: anxiety

Posts.Content: Helloe everyone,   I had chemo, masectomy and rads which finished three months ago. I still have a lot of discomfort in side, arm and armpit after all this time. The oncologist says it is early days, has anyone else had this discomfort for so long and how long does it last.  I forgot to ask him!! Hope you are all enjoying this lovely weather as best you can, Maggie
Posts.Title: arm and armpit pain

Posts.Content: Hi Dogsmummy,   I was quite relieved (in a way, if you know what I mean) to see your email. I havent seen anyone mention this before which adds to the tension. I had  chemo at the end of last year, right brest masectomy in January and 15 sessions of rads and I have had rib pain ever since which is  just bearable with painkillers and it has worried me a lot.  Ihave phoned my nurse several times and she says that that is the affect of the radiotherapy.  However, I have now had the long wait of three mon ths and am due to go back to Addenbrookes on Thursday when I hope I will get some more information about this and I will post and let you know how it goes.  All the very best to you and I know what you are going through -but the painkillers do help - its just so disappointing after all the treatment isnt it?  I am a dogs mummy too!! Or is that dogs body - he rules the roost!!  Take care, big hugs, Maggie
Posts.Title: Rib pain and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply Dorothee, went for my three month appointment last Thursday and he listened to my chest  and prodded a bit and says I will have a scan, so now await the appointment date and then results.  Trying to do excercises but it is a bit painful.   Told me I looked very well but that is all the information I got regarding the progress of the treatment, is that usual?    Thank you so much for your support, Maggie
Posts.Title: Rib pain and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi there,   I have just come back from my GP  - he has put me back on Alendronic Acid tablets and the chewable Acdal D3 for my osteoporosis.  I have had chemo and masectomy and 15 rads for breast cancer - I go bck to Addenbrookes in six weeks time for results. I hope this information is useful to you and wish you all the best.  Maggie
Posts.Title: Calcium Suppliments ?

Posts.Content: Hi Freeola, Yes I am plagued by it, I have had chemo, operation rb and radiotherapy finishing last April and have had rib pain from about August,  Had MRI scan and bones all ok, keep going back to Doctor who says he is running out of ideas and I could go for a second opinion. I phoned breast nurse at Addenbrookes and have an appointment in two weeks time.  I cant bear a bra on all day and am on morphine patches and 6 or 7 cocodomol tabets a day.  I thought I was never going to hear of anyone else who is having this problem. I do do my excercises but I am not really sure if they help or not but I really do need to get this sorted or at least explained. I will  let you know how I get on - I realise this doesn't help you but at least you know you are not the only one.  I know just how you feel!!   Hugs Maggie
Posts.Title: Pain in the ribs

Posts.Content: Thanks Wendi for your reply.  I suppose it was a silly question to ask, if your are not taking any drugs and having side affects you would not be asking for opinions and advice so I would not have heard of anybody in the same position as me.  I would feel a bit of a banana asking now after six months since finishing treatment. Just feel sometimes like I have been abandoned after all the treatments and trauma you know??   Thank you anyway, all the best, Maggie
Posts.Title: Medication after chemo and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi everybody, I am just wondering if there is anyone out there who isn't on medication of any sort after treatment.  I had chemo last November   I went back for the three , r b mastectomy in January and then fifteen sessions of radiotherapy. I went back for the three month check up and all was ok but I don't go back till May 2014 and I have no medication, is it because I am post menopausal?  I do take pain killers for rib pain which the doctor cant fathom out, I was having this for years before the cancer and had exrays and everything for it.  But why no medication like everybody else, I realise I can ask the nurse but just wondered if anyone else is the same as me?  Take care lovely ladies, this site is such a comfort and support all the very best to you all. Maggie
Posts.Title: Medication after chemo and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Starting last October I have had chemotherapy, right breast masectomy and then 15 sessions radiotherapy. Went back for the three month appointment and  was told they were very pleased with the treatment but as I had rib pains I was to have a bone scan for osteoporosis. As that machine was under alteration on that day I had a whole body scan with a  different  scanner.  Went back yesterday for the results and was told the good news that my bones were only showing the signs of ageing and that there was no cancer in all vital organs.  I am to go back in May 2014. I am only taking cocodomol now for rib and back pain and half lorazopan at night for sleep. Where does that leave me?  The trouble is that we did not see our usual consultant,, we had a foreign lady that we could hardly understand, there was a lot of confusion abvout the scan and she had to go away and check, before that she had examined me and said there was a problem in my stomach.  When she came back, she said sorry and that I had no signs of cancer.  I still have to go on Tuesday to the osteoporosis dept for consultation. We dont know where we are.  Just wonder if anyone else has experienced this - you have all been so good and there always seems to be someone who can offer advice or suggestions.  Family and friends are all saying "wonderful, get on with your life now" but I dont feel like that, I feel sort of bewildered, is this normal?  Is it all in my head? Big hugs to everyone out there, Maggie
Posts.Title: in limbo

Posts.Content: I have had chemo and rb masectomy in January and 15 sessions of radiotherapy. I still have pain under my arm and in my side - is this normal?  I finished my rads four weeks ago and next appointment with hospital is 4th July.  This is a wonderful site - so good to know you are not alone as even with family and friends around and being supportive - I do sometimes feel really alone with this.  Thank you.  Maggie
Posts.Title: pain still after rads
